definition: to read a book/to study/to attend school
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
to start reading furiously, contrary to previous habit (idiom)

sentences.english: These arenormally sedate affairs where empty chairs outnumber the audience.
sentences.chinese: 一般来说，空椅子比听众多是读书会上很平常的事。

sentences.english: Reading is good, but we have to choose what to read.
sentences.chinese: 读书是一好事，但我们必须多加注意书的选择。

sentences.english: Yang Xiaojie is reading a book.
Great joy of reading, not to invite good name.
sentences.chinese: 自得读书乐，不邀为善名。

sentences.english: Most ancient Chinese people thought that nothing is lofty except reading books.
sentences.chinese: 大多数古人认为万般皆下品唯有读书高。

sentences.english: Long, long ago, there is a student who likes to travel.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，有个读书人喜欢游山玩水。

sentences.english: They are to live up to expectations, in our study hard, under-funded, university.
sentences.chinese: 他们很争气，在我们的资助下用功读书，考上大学。

sentences.english: Wang Jing in Changping, a secondary school, usually resident.
sentences.chinese: 王静在昌平一所中专读书，平常住校。

sentences.english: Not (being) fond of learning, he ran away from home.
sentences.chinese: 由于不喜欢读书，他就离家出奔了。

sentences.english: His family was very poor, but he worked hard at his studies even in early childhood.
sentences.chinese: 孔子的家里很穷，但是他从小就认真读书，刻苦学习。

sentences.english: He was a member of the Reading Club last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年他曾是读书社的一员。

sentences.english: He studies very hard every day.
Q30: Does reading have anything to do with my oral English?
sentences.chinese: 读书跟说好英文怎么会有关系？

sentences.english: Philately pingpong roller skating reading and music.
sentences.chinese: 集邮乒乓球轮滑读书和音乐。

sentences.english: You may also want to inquire about scheduled book reports or upcoming projects.
sentences.chinese: 可能您也想询问是否要写读书报告或者其他的作业。

definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
to go to school/to attend school
to seek knowledge/to study/to attend college
diligent/industrious (in one's studies)/to study hard/to make great effort
